intro: Tephrosia pachypoda, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, featuring compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, green pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Tephrosia pachypoda is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
